positions.title: Post-Doctoral Associate
positions.description:
RNAi-based therapeutics with an emphasis on pancreatic cancer
Cathy Yao Laboratory
Michael E. Debakey Dept. of Surgery
Department of Molecular Virology and Microbiology
Baylor College of Medicine

Postdoctoral Associate (Former Graduate Student), Qizhi Yao Laboratory

-Studied the molecular mechanisms that give rise to pancreatic cancer pathogenesis in vitro and in vivo with an emphasis on therapeutic development using nanoparticle-based delivery of oligonucleotides

-Examined clinical relevance of tumorigenic factors to identify a nucleic acid and protein biomarker signature of pancreatic cancer, as well as functional effects of RNAi and virus-like particle (VLP) treatment and on cancer cells and cancer stem cells in vitro and in vivo. A patent has been filed for my work.


In vitro experience in: cancer/ cell culture; functional assays of tumorigenesis; cloning and construct generation; HLA typing; in-situ hybridization; VLP production; Southern, northern and western blotting; high throughput sequencing; microfluidics; RNAi; qPCR; immunohistochemistry; HPLC; flow cytometry; ChIP; etc.; design and generation of polymer nanoparticles for the delivery of miRNA/siRNA

In vivo experience with both subcutaneous and orthotopic mouse models, including injection, surgery, and tissue collection and analysis; human patient tissue and blood sample analysis.

Research Assistant, Paul Ling laboratory: studied murine gammaherpesvirus (MHV68) as a model for the mediation of intrinsic cellular host defense responses against virus infections.

Teaching Assistant, General Virology (Graduate Level Course)

positions.title: Research Consultant
positions.description: -Design and implementation of experiments for HIV non-nucleoside inhibitor vaccine development in vitro and in vivo (rabbits), including BSL 3 HIV manipulation (p24 ELISA, virus titration, UV-mediated viral inactivation, infection, collection, and electron microscopy visualization and testing of infectious virus).

positions.title: Co-Founder, Vice President of Business Development
positions.description:
· Developed original concept and corresponding business plan and business model.
-Conducted market research that allowed for the definition of a business model and product line determination. 
-Formed collaborative partnerships with overseas manufacturers in China, India, and the Middle East, as well as within the United States.
-Coordinated domestic and international operations of the company: Negotiated orders and shipments with manufacturers and suppliers. 
-Responsible for distribution agreements with dozens of companies in both the U.S and abroad. 
-Managed licensing agreements and exclusive distribution portfolios with private biotechnology companies for proprietary products and technologies.
-Managed and trained sales personnel
-Coordinated warehouse shipping and logistics activities. Served as liaison between investors and customers. 
-Responsible for website/catalog design and development.
-Evaluated several proprietary technologies and helped take them to market. 
-Acting sales representative and manager of sales team; built customer relations and provided customer service and support. Developed customer base to include over 600 customers in research laboratories and companies throughout the U.S.

positions.title: Consultant
positions.description: · Developed a strategic growth plan for the orthopedics company. Conducted market research and financial forecasts for the company's proprietary CAD/CAM software. Completed detailed financial and operational plans to enable expansion and define a new direction for the company.

educations.schoolName: Case Western Reserve University - Weatherhead School of Management

allData.headline: CEO at Speratum Biopharma
allData.summary:
I previously worked as a Post-Doctoral Associate in the Department of Surgery at Baylor College of Medicine (BCM), in the laboratories of Dr. Qizhi Yao and Dr. Changyi Chen, with a focus on developing RNAi-based therapeutics for the treatment of cancer. 

That work is the basis for Speratum, a pre-clinical stage cancer therapy company with exclusive licenses for multiple technologies originally developed at BCM.  At Speratum we combine RNA interference (RNAi) and synthetic biology with a novel, polymeric nanoparticle-based delivery system. Our main focus is  on the treatment of pancreatic and ovarian cancers. We are currently developing novel targeted antiviral applications of our technology. 

I have been executive director of Speratum since its foundation in 2014. I have Ph.D. in Molecular Virology and Microbiology from BCM, an MS in Entrepreneurial Biotechnology from the Science and Technology Entrepreneurship Program (STEP) at Case, and a BS in molecular biology from Florida Tech. 

I have previously worked as a consultant to biotechnology start-up companies and governmental organizations. My work has contributed to the development of projects ranging from medical devices to HIV research. 

I am a founding member of the Scientific Ethics Committee for the Ministry of Health of Costa Rica, founding member of CRBiomed, the biomedical cluster of Costa Rica, and am a member of the Aspen Global Leadership Network (AGLN), the Aspen Institute, and the Central American Leadership Initiative (CALI).
